unnormalised: New Delhi Grapples with Deteriorating Air Quality Post-Diwali Celebrations
normalised: New Delhi Grapples with Deteriorating Air Quality Post-Diwali Celebrations

unnormalised: New Delhi – Air quality across the National Capital Region (NCR) has plummeted to "severe" levels following Diwali celebrations, according to the Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB). The Air Quality Index (AQI) readings in areas like Anand Vihar and RK Puram have consistently exceeded 400, posing significant health risks.
normalised: New Delhi – Air quality across the National Capital Region (N C R) has plummeted to "severe" levels following Diwali celebrations, according to the Central Pollution Control Board (C P C B). The Air Quality Index (A Q I) readings in areas like Anand Vihar and R K Puram have consistently exceeded four hundred, posing significant health risks.

unnormalised: Experts attribute the surge in pollution to a combination of factors, including firecracker emissions, stubble burning in neighbouring states like Punjab and Haryana, and unfavourable meteorological conditions. The Delhi government has announced measures including increased water sprinkling and a temporary ban on construction activities.

unnormalised: Dr. Sharma of AIIMS Delhi cautioned residents, particularly children and the elderly, to limit outdoor activities. The dip in air quality casts a shadow on upcoming festivities, with concerns raised about the impact on events like the grand Onam Sadhya being planned at Kerala Bhavan. The CPCB urges citizens to adopt sustainable practices to mitigate the adverse effects. Further, the monitoring stations recorded PM2.5 levels exceeding 300 micrograms per cubic meter in several areas.
